name: Orange Shallot Marsala Pork Chops
author: CHEEREEO
summary: Easy one-dish weeknight pork chops with a delicious glaze and pan sauce. As a variation, you may add 8 ounces of sliced mushrooms with the shallots.
ingredients: salt and ground black pepper to taste
1 tablespoon all-purpose flour, or as needed
½ cup freshly squeezed tangerine juice
directions: Season pork chops generously with salt and black pepper; dust lightly with flour
Heat a large skillet over medium-high heat and add olive oil to the hot skillet
Brown pork chops in the hot oil, about 5 minutes per side
Reduce heat to medium and scatter shallot around chops
Continue to cook meat, flipping once, until chops are fork-tender, 10 to 15 minutes
Stir occasionally to prevent shallots from burning
Pour tangerine juice and Marsala wine into skillet; bring to a boil
Cook until juice and wine reduce to a glaze, 3 to 5 minutes
Return pork chops to skillet and sprinkle with orange zest; add butter to skillet
Flip chops in glaze until coated
